alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:28PM CDT until May 21 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Yellow Medicine, Chippewa and Lac qui Parle Counties. .Accumulating rainfall has occurred across southern Minnesota Friday night into this evening. Totals so far have reached 2 to even 4 plus inches in some localized areas with additional rainfall expected tonight. This has caused river levels in this region to either rapidly rise or delay falling. Crests should occur within the next few days before a dry pattern this coming week allows for river decreases again. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY, MAY 21... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Montevideo. * WHEN...Until Sunday, May 21. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Low lying areas and some roads along the river begin flooding, along with some basements of houses along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Saturday, the stage was 14.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 PM CDT Saturday was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Saturday morning and continue falling to 13.9 feet next Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.6 feet on 07/26/1962. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine
